posts.author: PaladinPete
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for Handling, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

For my next character, I want to focus on Handling as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Handling to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

In my campaign, we had a situation with Handling that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: WarlocksWisdom
posts.content:
How do other DMs balance encounters that involve Handling? I find it either makes combats too easy or too difficult.

For my next character, I want to focus on Handling as a central feature. What subclasses or multiclass options would work best with this?

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around Handling? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

posts.content:
